intro: Planchonella densinervia, commonly known as the dense-veined pittosporum, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible berries that are orange when ripe. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
